windows, macOS and Linux are supported.
To get started, you can scaffold the pro: To get started, you can scaffold the project with the [mbc-cqrs-serverless CLI](./cli.md). To scaffold the project with the mbc-cqrs-serverless CLI, run the following commands. This will create a new project directory, and populate the directory with the initial core mbc-cqrs-serverless files and supporting modules, creating a conventional base structure for your project.
If you're new to mbc-cqrs-serverless, se: If you're new to mbc-cqrs-serverless, see the [project structure](./project-structure.md) docs for an overview of all the possible files and folders in your application.
Run `npm run build` to the build project: Run `npm run build` to the build project using development mode.
Open in other terminal session and run `: Open in other terminal session and run `npm run offline:docker`
Open in other terminal session and run `npm run migrate` to migrate RDS and dynamoDB table
Finally, run `npm run offline:sls` to st: Finally, run `npm run offline:sls` to start serverless offline mode.
After the server runs successfully, you: After the server runs successfully, you can see:
You can also use several endpoints: You can also use several endpoints
Run `npx prisma studio` to open studio w: Run `npx prisma studio` to open studio web: http://localhost:5000
In the local environment, if you have tr: In the local environment, if you have trouble with the `npm run migrate` command or cannot log in with local Cognito, you will need to add more permissions to files and folders using the command below:
If you have port conflicts with other se: If you have port conflicts with other services (e.g., another MySQL instance, another application using port 3000), you can configure the local service ports via environment variables in your `.env` file.
To change the API Gateway port from 3000: To change the API Gateway port from 3000 to 3010 and MySQL port from 3306 to 3307, add the following to your `.env` file:
After changing the ports, restart all se: After changing the ports, restart all services:
Stop all running services (Docker and Se: Stop all running services (Docker and Serverless Offline)
Run `npm run offline:docker` to restart: Run `npm run offline:docker` to restart Docker services
Run `npm run offline:sls` to restart Ser: Run `npm run offline:sls` to restart Serverless Offline
The port configuration is automatically: The port configuration is automatically applied to all related services including Docker Compose, Serverless Offline, and the DynamoDB stream trigger script. You only need to set the environment variables once in your `.env` file.
Local port configuration feature was add: Local port configuration feature was added in [version 1.0.26](/docs/changelog#v1026).
